title.en: Eileen Chang and her Characters Series
title.zh-hant: 張愛玲與她的人物角色系列

images.altText: Ink painting on paper of six versions of the same woman in a row against a blank background. Each version is identical except for clothing and hairstyle. The version furthest to the right has grey hair.

Acrylic painting on canvas with paper collage depicting seven women with identical figures standing in a line, each wearing a different outfit and hairstyle, identified by individual titles such as ‘Flowers of Shanghai’, ‘Hong Kong 1940’s’ and ‘Father Takes a Bride’.
Colour pencil on paper depicting a woman standing in a tiled hallway. One side of the hallway is open to a courtyard. The woman is in colour, while the scene around her is in black and white.

Colour pencil on paper depicting a woman in a cheongsam standing in front of a large, mansion-like building with a British flag on top. A man is looking out from the roof. The woman is in colour, while the scene around her is in black and white.

Colour pencil on paper depicting a woman standing in a room next to a round table with bowls and chopsticks. Another woman stands on the opposite side of the table with two bowls in her hands. The first woman is in colour, while the scene around her is in black and white.
Colour pencil on paper depicting a woman in a cheongsam standing next to a man in a suit sitting on the floor. The woman is in colour, while the scene around her is black and white.

Colour pencil on paper depicting an old woman standing on a street in front of a building. The Hollywood sign can be seen in the hills behind the building. The woman is in colour, while the background is black and white.
